item.title: In Measure Theory: Almost Everywhere and Almost Surely
item.description: Definition 1 If a function $f : E \to \overline{\mathbb{R}}$, excluding a set $E_{0} \subset E$ where $m(E_{0}) = 0$, has some property $P$, then $f$ is said to have property $P$ almost everywhere within $E$.
